intro: Hakea deurrens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces cylindrical, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in dry conditions. Hakea deurrens is often found in coastal and inland heathlands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
